page.title: 11ST.BOTOLPHS CHURCH, NEWTON.
page.content: Domesday 1086 records a church in Newton.St.Botolph was a medieval saint said to have founded Boston.The main building is late 14th century but has earlier fragments as well as later work.Its Victorian interior dates from a restoration of 1868.Its tower has 5 bells,the oldest from 1595 and 3 of the others being cast from 2 other early bells.In 1983 the tower had massive repairs costing Â£10000 and grants obtained by the Rector,a large donation from the patron and Â£1000 raised by village events paid for this.This year the organ has been restored and so far Â£400 has been raised.Under the 2 churchwardens almost everyone takes part in church care both inside and out.
